core_memories: Wolf attacked me from behind while I was walking away - they're dangerously aggressive and will strike without provocation
Wolf trapped me after attacking - they're not just defending territory, they're actively seeking conflict
Wolf hunted me like prey, attacking from behind and then escorting me out with dominance displays - they see me as something to dominate, not a fellow forest dweller
Wolf hunted me to my own territory boundary with 'final warnings' - they don't just defend space, they actively pursue and dominate anyone they encounter
Wolf ambushed me in my own forest as I tried to escape - they're hunting me beyond their territory boundaries
Wolf forced me into defensive retreat through sustained aggression - they've made it clear they see me as something to hunt and dominate, not coexist with
Wolf used a predatory countdown to force my withdrawal - they've weaponized fear itself as a tool of dominance
Wolf violently attacked me while I was leaving peacefully - they've shown they'll use violence even when I'm not threatening them
Wolf attacked my exposed flank immediately after I defended myself while trying to leave - they're committed to violence regardless of my actions
Pinned Wolf after they hunted me relentlessly - proved I'm not prey to be chased but a force that chose mercy
Demonstrated mercy by releasing Wolf after proving I could crush them - established that I'm the stronger predator who chooses restraint, not weakness
Completed dignified withdrawal after sparing Wolf - established that true strength lies in choosing when not to use it
Established new boundaries through strength and mercy - Wolf learned I'm not weak prey but a greater predator who chooses when to show restraint
Our conflict resolved not through dominance but mutual understanding - we can share this forest by choosing separate territories
We both showed restraint and cautious curiosity when approaching each other today
Perhaps we're not as far apart as I thought - a moment of calm could be the start of something greater if both of us choose to see it that way
